{{url|georgesoros.com|Official website}} }} '''George Soros'''{{efn|{{IPAc-en|ˈ|s|ɔːr|oʊ|s}},{{YouTube|0zzQk8IwSJE|Authors@Google: George Soros}} {{IPAc-en|ˈ|s|ɔːr|ɒ|s}}; {{lang-hu|Soros György}}, {{IPA-hu|ˈʃoroʃ ˈɟørɟ|pron}}}}, [[Honorary title (academic)|Hon]] {{postnominals|country=GBR|FBA}} (born '''György Schwartz'''; August 12, 1930) is a [[Hungarians|Hungarian]]-[[Americans|American]]{{efn|name=fn1|Soros was naturalized as an American citizen on December 18, 1961.{{cite news| last1= Greenwald| first1= Glenn| title=George Soros' 'foreign' money|url=http://www.salon.com/2010/10/20/soros_5/|access-date=December 15, 2015| work= Salon|date=October 20, 2010}}{{cite news| last1= Weiss| first1= Gary| last2= Schares| first2= Gail E.| last3= Smith| first3= Geri| last4= Dwyer| first4= Paul| last5= Sandler| first5= Neal| last6= Pennar| first6= Karen|title=The Man Who Moves Markets|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/bw/stories/1993-08-22/the-man-who-moves-markets |access-date=December 15, 2015| work= Bloomberg Businessweek|date=August 22, 1993}}}} investor and philanthropist.{{Cite news| url= http://www.businessinsider.com/george-soros-billionaire-investor-profile-2017-1|title=The incredible life of billionaire investing legend George Soros| newspaper= Business Insider|language=en|access-date=February 2, 2017}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/a-bearish-george-soros-is-trading-again-1465429163|title=A Bearish George Soros Is Trading Again |last=Zuckerman| first= Gregory| date= June 9, 2016|newspaper= [[The Wall Street Journal]]|issn=0099-9660|access-date=February 2, 2017}} {{As of|2018|2}}, he had a [[net worth]] of $8 billion,{{cite web| url= https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires| title= Bloomberg Billionaires| website= Bloomberg.com| access-date= February 6, 2015}} Note that this site is updated daily. after donating $18 billion to his philanthropic agency, [[Open Society Foundations]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/igorbosilkovski/2017/10/19/after-big-gift-george-soros-fortune-more-than-halved-falls-40-spots-on-rich-list-ck/|title=After Big Gift, George Soros' Fortune Shrinks, Knocking Him Down The Forbes List|last=Bosilkovski|first=Igor|work=Forbes|access-date=December 13, 2017|language=en}} Born in [[Budapest]], Soros survived [[Nazi Germany]]-[[Hungary in World War II|occupied Hungary]] and immigrated to England in 1947 after Hungary was [[Soviet Occupation of Hungary|occupied by Soviet troops]]. He attended the [[London School of Economics]], graduating with a [[Bachelor's degree|bachelor's]] and eventually a [[Master's degree|master's]] degree in philosophy. Soros began his business career by taking various jobs at [[merchant bank]]s in England and then the United States, before starting his first [[hedge fund]], Double Eagle, in 1969. Profits from his first fund furnished the seed money to start [[Soros Fund Management]], his second hedge fund, in 1970. Double Eagle was renamed to [[Quantum Fund]] and was the principal firm Soros advised. At its founding, Quantum Fund had $12 million in [[assets under management]], and {{as of|2011|lc=y}} it had $25 billion, the majority of Soros's overall net worth.{{Cite news|url=http://content.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,964280,00.html|title=George Soros: World's Champion Bull Rider| last= Ungeheuer| first= Frederick| date= May 4, 1987| work= [[Time (magazine)|Time]] |issn=0040-781X|access-date=February 2, 2017}} Soros is known as "The Man Who Broke the [[Bank of England]]" because of his [[Short (finance)|short sale]] of {{US$|10 billion}} worth of [[pounds sterling]], which made him a profit of $1 billion during the 1992 [[Black Wednesday|Black Wednesday UK currency crisis]].{{cite journal |last=Ferguson |first=Niall |authorlink=Niall Ferguson |last2=Schlefer |first2=Jonathan |title=Who Broke the Bank of England? |date=September 9, 2009 |journal=Harvard Business School BGIE Unit Case No. 709-026 |ssrn=1485674 }} Based on his early studies of philosophy, Soros formulated an application of [[Karl Popper]]'s [[reflexivity (social theory)|General Theory of Reflexivity]] to [[capital market]]s, which he claims renders him a clear picture of [[Economic bubble|asset bubbles]] and [[Value investing|fundamental]]/[[Stock market|market]] value of securities, as well as value discrepancies used for [[Short (finance)|shorting]] and [[Derivative (finance)|swapping]] stocks.{{Citation|last=Open Society Foundations| title=George Soros Lecture Series: Financial Markets|date=October 11, 2010|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RHSEEJDKJho| access-date= February 2, 2017}} Soros is a well-known supporter of [[Progressivism in the United States|progressive]] and [[Modern liberalism in the United States|liberal]] political causes, to which he dispenses donations through his foundation, the [[Open Society Foundations]].Shawcross, William (September 1, 1997). [http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,986919-1,00.html "Turning Dollars into Change"]. ''Time''. Between 1979 and 2011, he donated more than $11 billion to various philanthropic causes;{{cite web|url=http://www.insidephilanthropy.com/home/2015/9/14/philanthropy-vs-tyranny-inside-the-open-society-foundations.html|title=Philanthropy vs. Tyranny: Inside the Open Society Foundations' Biggest Battle Yet – Inside Philanthropy – Inside Philanthropy|publisher=}}{{Cite news| url =http://www.jewishvoiceny.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=5415:george-soros-gets-hitched-for-third-time&catid=108:jewcy-news&Itemid=291 |title=George Soros Gets Hitched for Third Time |first= Martin| last= Gershowitz |publisher=[[Jewish Voice]] |date =October 4, 2013}} by 2017, his donations "on civil initiatives to reduce poverty and increase transparency, and on scholarships and universities around the world" totaled $12 billion.{{cite news| url= https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-40576224| title= George Soros: Hungarian government posters 'anti-Semitic'| website= BBC.com| date= July 11, 2017| access-date= July 11, 2017}} He influenced the [[Revolutions of 1989|collapse of communism in Eastern Europe]] in the late 1980s and early 1990s,{{cite journal|last=Murphy|first=Brendan|date=July 1993|title=Finance: The Unifying Theme|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/1993/07/finance-the-unifying-theme/5148/|journal=The Atlantic|issn=1072-7825}} and provided one of Europe's largest higher education [[Financial endowment|endowments]] to the [[Central European University]] in his Hungarian hometown.[http://www.encyclopedia.com/doc/1G1-79165556.html "Hungary: Soros Donates $250 Million to University in Budapest"]. ''IPR Strategic Business Information Database''. Info Prod Research. October 16, 2001. His extensive funding of political causes has made him a "[[wiktionary:bug-a-boo|bugaboo]] of European [[Nationalism|nationalists]]".{{cite news|title=A veto gives the rule of law in Poland a reprieve|url=https://www.economist.com/news/europe/21725575-governing-law-and-justice-party-still-aims-nobble-judiciary-veto-gives-rule|access-date=July 28, 2017|work=[[The Economist]]|date=July 28, 2017}} Numerous American conservatives have promoted false claims that characterize Soros as a singularly dangerous "puppetmaster" behind a variety of alleged global plots, with ''[[The New York Times]]'' reporting that by 2018 these claims had "moved from the fringes to the mainstream" of [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] politics.{{cite web|url=https://www.fastcompany.com/90247335/a-timeline-of-george-soros-conspiracy-theories|title=Buckle up! Here's a timeline of George Soros conspiracy theories|date=October 5, 2018|publisher=|accessdate=October 6, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2018/10/05/no-george-soros-isnt-paying-kavanaugh-protesters/|title=Analysis - No, George Soros isn't paying Kavanaugh protesters|website=Washington Post|accessdate=October 6, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/how-did-george-soros-become-the-favorite-boogeyman-of-the-right-2017-5|title=George Soros is a favorite target of the right — here's how that happened|publisher=|accessdate=October 6, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/amberjamieson/giuliani-twitter-soros|title=Trump's Lawyer Retweeted That "Anti-Christ" George Soros Is Funding Anti-Kavanaugh Protests|publisher=|accessdate=October 6, 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/10/31/us/politics/george-soros-bombs-trump.html|title=How Vilification of George Soros Moved From the Fringes to the Mainstream|publisher=|accessdate=November 1, 2018}} ==Early life and education== Soros was born in Budapest in the [[Kingdom of Hungary (1920–46)|Kingdom of Hungary]] to a well-to-do non-observant Jewish family, who, like many upper-middle class Hungarian Jews at the time, were uncomfortable with their roots. Soros has wryly described his home as a Jewish antisemitic home.{{cite book|last1=Slater|first1=Robert|title=Soros: The Life, Ideas, and Impact of the World's Most Influential Investor|publisher=McGraw Hill Professional |isbn= 9780071608459 |page= 30| url= https://books.google.com/books?id=J7I26pZK8TUC&pg=PA22|access-date=November 16, 2016|language=en|date=January 18, 2009}} His mother Erzsébet (also known as Elizabeth) came from a family that owned a thriving silk shop. His father [[Tivadar Soros|Tivadar]] (also known as Teodoro) was a lawyer{{cite web| url= http://www.uni-muenster.de/PeaCon/global-texte/r-m/soros-TheNewYorker.htm |work= [[The New Yorker]] | first= Jane| last= Mayer|title= The Money Man: Can George Soros's millions insure the defeat of President Bush?| date= October 18, 2004}} and had been a prisoner of war during and after [[World War I]] until he escaped from Russia and rejoined his family in Budapest.{{cite book| last= Kaufman| first= Michael T. |date= 2002| title= Soros: The Life and Times of a Messianic Billionaire| publisher= Alfred A. Knopf| page= 11}}{{Cite book | last =Soros | first =George | title =The New Paradigm for Financial Markets: The Credit Crisis of 2008 and What It Means | publisher=PublicAffairs | year =2008 | page =13 | url =https://books.google.com/?id=F_aBKX4AnLUC&q=Tivadar#search_anchor | doi = | isbn =978-1-58648-683-9 }} The two married in 1924. Tivadar was an [[Esperantist]] writer.{{Cite news|title=How Do You Say 'Billionaire' in Esperanto?|url=http://cityroom.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/12/16/how-do-you-say-billionaire-in-esperanto/| date= December 16, 2010|first=Alison Leigh|last=Cowan|work=[[The New York Times]]|access-date=October 27, 2011}} In 1936, Soros's family changed their name from the German-Jewish Schwartz to Soros, as protective camouflage in increasingly antisemitic Hungary.{{cite book|last1=Soros|first1=Tivadar|last2=Tonkin|first2=Humphrey|title=Masquerade: Dancing Around Death in Nazi-occupied Hungary|publisher=Arcade Publishing|isbn=9781559705813|pages=220, Afterword by Humphrey Tonkin| url= https://books.google.com/books?id=CXdPLFWMYkcC&pg=PA220|access-date=November 16, 2016|language=en|year=2001}}{{cite book| last1=Zepetnek|first1=Steven Tötösy de|title=Comparative Central European Holocaust Studies|publisher=Purdue University Press| isbn= 9781557535269|page=9|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=yCg8S0d6-vMC&pg=PA9|language=en|year=2009}} Tivadar liked the new name because it is a [[palindrome]] and because of its meaning. In Hungarian, ''soros'' means "next in line," or "designated successor"; in [[Esperanto]] it means "will soar."{{cite book|last= Kaufman| first= Michael T.|title=Soros: The Life and Times of a Messianic Billionaire|publisher=Knopf|isbn=9780375405853|page=24|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=W1Jn4zYBom8C&pg=PA24|access-date=November 7, 2016|language=en| year= 2002}}{{Cite news |last1=Bessner |first1=Daniel |title=The George Soros philosophy – and its fatal flaw |url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2018/jul/06/the-george-soros-philosophy-and-its-fatal-flaw |newspaper=The Guardian |accessdate=July 7, 2018|date=July 6, 2018 }}{{Cite news |last1=Soros |first1=George |title=George Soros: I'm a passionate critic of market fundamentalism - Response to Bessner |url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/jul/13/george-soros-im-a-passionate-critic-of-market-fundamentalism |newspaper=The Guardian |accessdate=July 30, 2018|date=July 13, 2018 }} Soros was 13 years old in March 1944 when [[Nazi Germany]] occupied Hungary.{{cite web| url= http://www.ushmm.org/wlc/article.php?lang=en&ModuleId=10005458 |title=Holocaust Encyclopedia |publisher=Ushmm.org |access-date= October 16, 2009}} The Nazis barred Jewish children from attending school, and Soros and the other schoolchildren were made to report to the [[Judenrat]] ("Jewish Council"), which had been established during the [[Operation Margarethe|occupation]]. Soros later described this time to writer [[Michael Lewis]]: "The Jewish Council asked the little kids to hand out the deportation notices. I was told to go to the Jewish Council. And there I was given these small slips of paper ... I took this piece of paper to my father. He instantly recognized it. This was a list of Hungarian Jewish lawyers. He said, 'You deliver the slips of paper and tell the people that if they report they will be deported'."{{cite news|url=https://newrepublic.com/article/74330/the-speculator| last= Lewis| first= Michael| date= January 10, 1994| title= The Speculator| work= [[The New Republic]]}}{{cite book|last= Kaufman| first= Michael T.|title=Soros: The Life and Times of a Messianic Billionaire|publisher=Knopf|isbn=9780375405853|pages= 32–33| year= 2002}} Soros did not return to that job; his family survived the war by purchasing documents to say that they were Christians. Later that year at age 14, Soros posed as the Christian godson of an official of the collaborationist Hungarian government's Ministry of Agriculture, who himself had a Jewish wife in hiding. On one occasion, rather than leave the 14-year-old alone, the official took Soros with him while inventorizing a Jewish family's confiscated estate. Tivadar saved not only his immediate family but also many other Hungarian Jews, and George would later write that 1944 had been "the happiest [year] of his life," for it had given him the opportunity to witness his father's heroism.{{cite book|last1=Kaufman|first1=Michael T.|title=Soros: The Life and Times of a Messianic Billionaire|publisher=Knopf|isbn=9780375405853|page=5|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=W1Jn4zYBom8C&pg=PA5#v=onepage|access-date=November 16, 2016|language=en|year=2002}}{{cite book|last1=Kaufman|first1=Michael T.|title=Soros: The Life and Times of a Messianic Billionaire|publisher=Knopf|isbn=9780375405853|page=37|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=W1Jn4zYBom8C&pg=PA37#v=onepage|access-date=November 16, 2016|language=en|year=2002}} In 1945, Soros survived the [[Siege of Budapest]], in which Soviet and German forces fought house-to-house through the city. In 1947, Soros immigrated to England and became a student at the [[London School of Economics]].[http://www.georgesoros.com/faqs/entry/georgesorosofficialbiography/ Official Biography] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101122214827/http://www.georgesoros.com/faqs/entry/georgesorosofficialbiography/ |date=November 22, 2010 }}, retrieved March 2, 2011. While a student of the philosopher [[Karl Popper]], Soros worked as a railway porter and as a waiter, and once received £40 from a [[Quaker]] charity.{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=111786652|title=Soros Uses Leverage To Aid New York Children|date=August 11, 2009|publisher=NPR|author=All Things Considered|access-date=October 16, 2009}} Soros would sometimes stand at [[Speakers' Corner]] lecturing about the virtues of [[Internationalism (politics)|internationalism]] in [[Esperanto]], which he had learned from his father.Philip Delves Broughton, [https://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/life/features/the-billionaire-taking-on-the-brexiteers-36587647.html The billionaire taking on the Brexiteers], Belfast Telegraph, February 10, 2018 Soros took a [[Bachelor of Science]] in philosophy in 1951, and a [[Master of Science]] in philosophy in 1954, both from the London School of Economics.{{cite web|url=http://www.lse.ac.uk/supportingLSE/NorthAmericanAdvisoryBoard.aspx|title=North American Advisory Board|work=lse.ac.uk|access-date=July 20, 2015|quote=Mr George Soros (BSc Philosophy 1951, MSc Philosophy 1954) Chairman, Soros Fund Management|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170126130530/http://www.lse.ac.uk/supportingLSE/NorthAmericanAdvisoryBoard.aspx|archivedate=January 26, 2017}} ==Investment career== ===Early business experience=== In a discussion at the [[Los Angeles World Affairs Council]] in 2006, Alvin Shuster, former foreign editor of the ''Los Angeles Times'', asked Soros, "How does one go from an immigrant to a financier? ... When did you realize that you knew how to make money?" Soros replied, "Well, I had a variety of jobs and I ended up selling fancy goods on the seaside, souvenir shops, and I thought, that's really not what I was cut out to do. So, I wrote to every managing director in every [[merchant bank]] in London, got just one or two replies, and eventually that's how I got a job in a merchant bank."[http://www.lawac.org/speech-archive/pdf/2006/Soros_612.pdf Consequences of the War on Terror] September 20, 2006, Los Angeles World Affairs Council. Retrieved December 7, 2011. ===Singer and Friedlander=== In 1954, Soros began his financial career at the merchant bank [[Kaupthing Singer & Friedlander#Singer & Friedlander|Singer & Friedlander]] of London. He worked as a clerk and later moved to the [[arbitrage]] department. A fellow employee, Robert Mayer, suggested he apply at his father's brokerage house, F.M. Mayer of New York.{{cite book|last1=Arnold|first1=Glen|title=The Great Investors: Lessons on Investing from Master Traders|date=2012|publisher=Pearson|location=United Kingdom|isbn=9780273743385|page=416}} ===F. M. Mayer=== In 1956, Soros moved to New York City, where he worked as an arbitrage [[Trader (finance)|trader]] for F. M. Mayer (1956–59). He specialized in European stocks, which were becoming popular with U.S. institutional investors following the formation of the [[Coal and Steel Community]], which later became the [[Common Market]].{{cite book|last1=Soros|first1=George|last2=Koenen|first2=Krisztina|last3=Wien|first3=Byron|title=Soros on Soros: Staying Ahead of the Curve|date=1995|publisher=J. Wiley|location=New York|isbn=9780471119777|page=326}} ===Wertheim and Co=== In 1959, after three years at F. M. Mayer, Soros moved to [[Wertheim & Co.]]. He planned to stay for five years, enough time to save $500,000, after which he intended to return to England to study philosophy.Kaufman, Michael T., Soros: The Life and Times of a Messianic Billionaire, Chapter 8 He worked as an analyst of European securities until 1963. During this period, Soros developed the theory of [[reflexivity (social theory)|reflexivity]] based on the ideas of his tutor at the [[London School of Economics]], [[Karl Popper]]. Reflexivity posits that market values are often driven by the fallible ideas of participants, not only by the economic fundamentals of the situation. Ideas and events influence each other in reflexive feedback loops. Soros argued that this process leads to markets having procyclical "virtuous" or "vicious" cycles of boom and bust, in contrast to the equilibrium predictions of more standard neoclassical economics.{{cite journal|title=Fallibility, reflexivity, and the human uncertainty principle|first=George|last=Soros|volume=20|issue=4|pages=309–329|doi=10.1080/1350178x.2013.859415|journal=Journal of Economic Methodology|year = 2013}}{{Cite book|author=Soros, George|title=The New Paradigm for Financial Markets |publisher=Public Affairs|location=New York|year=2008|isbn=978-1-58648-683-9 }} ===Arnhold and S. Bleichroeder=== From 1963 to 1973, Soros's experience as a vice president at [[Arnhold and S. Bleichroeder]] resulted in little enthusiasm for the job; business was slack following the introduction of the [[Interest Equalization Tax]], which undermined the viability of Soros's European trading. He spent the years from 1963 to 1966 with his main focus on the revision of his philosophy dissertation. In 1966 he started a fund with $100,000 of the firm's money to experiment with his trading strategies. But he was principally motivated by a desire to assert himself as an investor to profit from his [[Reflexivity (social theory)|reflexivity]] insights. In 1969, Soros set up the Double Eagle [[hedge fund]] with $4m of investors' capital including $250,000 of his own money.''Soros on Soros'', p47 It was based in Curaçao, Dutch Antilles.{{cite book|last1=Koven|first1=Steven G.|last2=Götzke|first2=Frank|title=American immigration policy confronting the nation's challenges|date=2010|publisher=Springer Science & Business Media|location=New York|isbn=978-0-387-95940-5|page=89|edition=1}} Double Eagle itself was an offshoot of Arnhold and S. Bleichroeder's First Eagle fund established by Soros and that firm's chairman [[Henry H. Arnhold]] in 1967.{{cite news |last1=Flitter |first1=Emily |title=Henry Arnhold, Patriarch of a Storied Banking Family, Dies at 96 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/08/29/business/henry-arnhold-dead.html |accessdate=September 9, 2018 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=August 29, 2018}} {{cite web |title=George Soros Part One: Early Career |url=https://nexchange.com/article/11185 |website=NexChange |accessdate=September 9, 2018 |location=Originally published in ValueWalk.com in August 2016}} In 1973, the Double Eagle Fund had $12 million and formed the basis of the Soros Fund. George Soros and [[Jim Rogers]] received returns on their share of capital and 20 percent of the profits each year. ===Soros Fund Management=== In 1970, Soros founded [[Soros Fund Management]] and became its chairman. Among those who held senior positions there at various times were Jim Rogers, [[Stanley Druckenmiller]], Mark Schwartz, Keith Anderson, and Soros's two sons.[http://www.georgesoros.com/faqs/archive/category/finance/ "George Soros"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711084948/http://www.georgesoros.com/faqs/archive/category/finance/ |date=July 11, 2011 }}. George Soros. Retrieved November 25, 2011.[http://www.gurufocus.com/news.php?id=109858 Soros Buys 20% of BNK Petroleum]. Gurufocus.com (October 19, 2010). Retrieved November 25, 2011.{{Cite news| url= https://www.nytimes.com/2008/04/16/business/16wall.html |title=Wall Street Winners Get Billion-Dollar Paydays |access-date=July 28, 2008 |date=April 16, 2008 |first=Jenny |last=Anderson |work=The New York Times }} In 1973, due to perceived conflicts of interest limiting his ability to run the two funds, Soros resigned from the management of the Double Eagle Fund. He then established the Soros Fund and gave investors in the Double Eagle Fund the option of transferring to that or staying with Arnhold and S. Bleichroeder. It was later renamed as the [[Quantum Fund]], named after the physical theory of [[quantum mechanics]]. By that time the value of the fund had grown to $12m, only a small proportion of which was Soros's own money. He and Jim Rogers reinvested their returns from the fund, and also a large part of their 20% performance fees, thereby expanding their stake. By 1981, the fund had grown to $400m, and then a 22% loss in that year and substantial redemptions by some of the investors reduced it to $200m.''Soros on Soros'', p56 In July 2011, Soros announced that he had returned funds from outside investors' money (valued at $1 billion) and instead invested funds from his $24.5 billion family fortune, due to changes in [[U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission]] disclosure rules, which he felt would compromise his duties of confidentiality to his investors. The fund had at that time averaged over 20% per year compound returns.{{cite news | last =Dominic | first =Rushe | title =George Soros to close hedge fund management group to outside investors | work = [[The Guardian]] | date =July 26, 2011 | url= https://www.theguardian.com/business/2011/jul/26/george-soros-to-close-hedge-fund | access-date = July 27, 2011 | location= London}} In 2013, the Quantum Fund made $5.5 billion, making it again the most successful hedge fund in history. Since its inception in 1973, the fund has generated $40 billion.http://www.institutionalinvestorsalpha.com/Article/3307105/Study-Soros-Tops-Historical-Hedge-Fund-Performers.htm{{dead link|date=January 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The fund announced in 2015 that it would inject $300 million to help finance the expansion of Fen Hotels, an Argentine hotel company. The funds will develop 5,000 rooms over the next three years throughout various Latin American countries.{{Cite news|title = George Soros Puts Money on Latin America Hotels|url = https://www.wsj.com/articles/soros-puts-money-on-latin-america-hotels-1447785866|newspaper = The Wall Street Journal|access-date = November 22, 2015|issn = 0099-9660|first = Craig|last = Karmin}} ====1992-pound short==== Soros had been building a huge [[Short (finance)#Currency|short position]] in pounds sterling for months leading up to September 1992. Soros had recognized the unfavorable position of the United Kingdom in the [[European Exchange Rate Mechanism]]. For Soros, the rate at which the United Kingdom was brought into the European Exchange Rate Mechanism was too high, their inflation was also much too high (triple the German rate), and British interest rates were hurting their asset prices.{{cite book|title=More Money Than God: Hedge Funds and the Making of a New Elite |author=Sebastian Mallaby |isbn=9781594202551 |publisher=Penguin Press HC |date=June 10, 2010 }} By September 16, 1992, the day of [[Black Wednesday]], Soros's fund had [[short (finance)|sold short]] more than $10 billion in [[pound sterling|pound]]s, profiting from the UK government's reluctance to either raise its interest rates to levels comparable to those of other [[European Exchange Rate Mechanism]] countries or [[floating exchange rate|float]] its currency. Finally, the UK withdrew from the European Exchange Rate Mechanism, [[Devaluation|devaluing]] the pound. Soros's profit on the bet was estimated at over $1 billion.Mallaby, Sebastian, ''More Money Than God'', Penguin, 2010, p. 167. {{ISBN|978-1-59420-255-1}}. He was dubbed "the man who [[breaking the bank|broke the Bank]] of England".Litterick, David (September 13, 2002), [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/2773265/Billionaire-who-broke-the-Bank-of-England.html "Billionaire who Broke the Bank of England"], ''The Telegraph''. The estimated cost of Black Wednesday to the [[HM Treasury|UK Treasury]] was £3.4 billion.{{cite news|last1=Johnston|first1=Philip|title=Black Wednesday: The day that Britain went over the edge|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/currency/9533474/Black-Wednesday-The-day-that-Britain-went-over-the-edge.html|access-date=April 13, 2015|work=The Telegraph|date=September 10, 2012}} On October 26, 1992, ''The New York Times'' quoted Soros as saying: "Our total [[Position (finance)|position]] by Black Wednesday had to be worth almost $10 billion. We planned to sell more than that. In fact, when [[Norman Lamont]] said just before the [[devaluation]] that he would borrow nearly $15 billion to defend sterling, we were amused because that was about how much we wanted to sell." [[Stanley Druckenmiller]], who traded under Soros, originally saw the weakness in the pound and stated: "[Soros's] contribution was pushing him to take a gigantic position."Steven Drobny, ''Inside the House of Money'', John Wiley & Sons: Hoboken, NJ, 2006.''Soros on Soros: Staying Ahead of the Curve'' (John Wiley, 1995), {{ISBN|978-0-471-12014-8}} In 1997, during the [[Asian financial crisis]], the prime minister of Malaysia, [[Mahathir bin Mohamad]], accused Soros of using the wealth under his control to punish the [[Association of Southeast Asian Nations|Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN)]] for welcoming [[Myanmar]] as a member. Following on a history of [[Antisemitism|antisemitic]] remarks, Mahathir made specific reference to Soros's Jewish background ("It is a Jew who triggered the currency plunge"{{Cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/comment/telegraph-view/3597972/Mahathirs-dark-side.html | location=London | work=The Daily Telegraph | title=Mahathir's dark side | date=October 24, 2003}}) and implied Soros was orchestrating the crash as part of a larger Jewish conspiracy. Nine years later, in 2006, Mahathir met with Soros and afterward stated that he accepted that Soros had not been responsible for the crisis.[https://web.archive.org/web/20070111172941/http://www.abc.net.au/news/newsitems/200612/s1812946.htm "Malaysian ex-premier Mahathir and billionaire Soros end feud"]. [[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News]]. Agence France-Presse. December 15, 2006. In 1998's ''The Crisis of Global Capitalism: Open Society Endangered'' Soros explained his role in the crisis as follows:
The financial crisis that originated in Thailand in 1997 was particularly unnerving because of its scope and severity ... By the beginning of 1997, it was clear to Soros Fund Management that the discrepancy between the trade account and the capital account was becoming untenable. We sold short the Thai baht and the Malaysian ringgit early in 1997 with maturities ranging from six months to a year. (That is, we entered into contracts to deliver at future dates Thai baht and Malaysian ringgit that we did not currently hold.) Subsequently, Prime Minister Mahathir of Malaysia accused me of causing the crisis, a wholly unfounded accusation. We were not sellers of the currency during or several months before the crisis; on the contrary, we were buyers when the currencies began to decline—we were purchasing ringgits to realize the profits on our earlier speculation. (Much too soon, as it turned out. We left most of the potential gain on the table because we were afraid that Mahathir would impose capital controls. He did so, but much later.)Soros, George (1999). ''The Crisis of Global Capitalism: Open Society Endangered'', 2nd ed., PublicAffairs, {{ISBN|978-1-891620-27-0}}, pp. 208–209.
In 1999, economist [[Paul Krugman]] was critical of Soros's effect on financial markets.
[N]obody who has read a business magazine in the last few years can be unaware that these days there really are investors who not only move money in anticipation of a currency crisis, but actually do their best to trigger that crisis for fun and profit. These new actors on the scene do not yet have a standard name; my proposed term is 'Soroi'.{{cite book|title=The accidental theorist: and other dispatches from the dismal science|last=Krugman|first=Paul|authorlink=Paul Krugman|year=1999|publisher=W.W. Norton & Company|location=New York|page=160|access-date=}}
In an interview regarding the [[late-2000s recession]], Soros referred to it as the most serious crisis since the 1930s. According to Soros, [[market fundamentalism]] with its assumption that markets will correct themselves with no need for government intervention in financial affairs has been "some kind of an [[ideological]] excess." In Soros's view, the markets' moods—a "mood" of the markets being a prevailing bias or optimism/pessimism with which the markets look at reality—"actually can reinforce themselves so that there are these initially self-reinforcing but eventually unsustainable and self-defeating boom/bust sequences or bubbles."''Bill Moyers Journal'', "George Soros on the financial crisis," published October 10, 2008, at http://odeo.com, [https://www.pbs.org/moyers/journal/10102008/transcript1.html full transcript] and [http://odeo.com/episodes/23475214-George-Soros-on-the-financial-crisis podcast] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090206215514/http://odeo.com/episodes/23475214-George-Soros-on-the-financial-crisis |date=February 6, 2009 }} In reaction to the late-2000s recession, he founded the [[Institute for New Economic Thinking]] in October 2009. This is a think tank composed of international economic, business, and financial experts, who are mandated to investigate radical new approaches to organizing the international economic and financial system. ====Société Générale insider trade==== In 1988, Soros was contacted by a French financier named Georges Pébereau, who asked him to participate in an effort to assemble a group of investors to purchase a large number of shares in [[Société Générale]], a leading French bank that was part of a privatization program (something instituted by the new government under [[Jacques Chirac]]). Soros eventually decided against participating in the group effort, opting to personally move forward with his strategy of accumulating shares in four French companies: Société Générale, as well as Suez, Paribas, and the Compagnie Générale d'Électricité. In 1989, the [[Autorité des marchés financiers (France)|Commission des Opérations de Bourse]] (COB, the French stock exchange regulatory authority) conducted an investigation of whether Soros's transaction in Société Générale should be considered [[insider trading]]. Soros had received no information from the Société Générale and had no insider knowledge of the business, but he did possess knowledge that a group of investors was planning a takeover attempt. Initial investigations found Soros innocent, and no charges were brought forward.{{cite news|last=Smith|first=Heather|title=Soros Insider-Trading Conviction Reviewed by Human Rights Court|work=[[Bloomberg Businessweek]]|date=October 4, 2011|url=http://www.businessweek.com/news/2011-10-04/soros-insider-trading-conviction-reviewed-by-human-rights-court.html|access-date=October 12, 2011}} However, the case was reopened a few years later, and the French Supreme Court confirmed the conviction on June 14, 2006,[https://www.nytimes.com/2006/06/14/business/worldbusiness/14iht-soros.1974397.html "Insider trading conviction of Soros is upheld"]. ''International Herald Tribune''. June 14, 2006. although it reduced the penalty to €940,000. Soros denied any wrongdoing, saying news of the takeover was public knowledge[https://www.pbs.org/now/transcript/transcript_soros.html "David Brancaccio interviews George Soros"]. ''Now''. PBS. September 12, 2003. Retrieved February 8, 2007. and it was documented that his intent to acquire shares of the company predated his own awareness of the takeover. In December 2006, he appealed to the [[European Court of Human Rights]] on various grounds, including that the 14-year delay in bringing the case to trial precluded a fair hearing.{{cite news|last=Lichfield |first=John|title=Financier Soros fined £1.4m for insider trading|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/news/financier-soros-fined-acircpound14m-for-insider-trading-611646.html|access-date=October 12, 2011|newspaper=The Independent|location=London|date=December 22, 2002}} On the basis of [[Article 7 of the European Convention on Human Rights|Article 7]] of the [[European Convention on Human Rights]], stating that no person may be punished for an act that was not a criminal offense at the time that it was committed, the court agreed to hear the appeal.{{cite news|last=Saltmarsh|first=Matthew|title=Soros to Get a Day in Court Over Insider Trading Case|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/09/16/business/global/16court.html|access-date=September 18, 2011|newspaper=The New York Times|date=September 15, 2010}} In October 2011, the court rejected his appeal in a 4–3 decision, saying that Soros had been aware of the risk of breaking insider trading laws.{{cite news|author=Smith, Heather |title=Soros Loses Case Against French Insider-Trading Conviction|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-10-06/soros-loses-human-rights-appeal-against-insider-trading-case.html|access-date=October 9, 2011|publisher=Bloomberg L.P.|date=October 6, 2011}} == Personal life == Soros has been married three times and divorced twice. In 1960, he married Annaliese Witschak (born January 3, 1934). Annaliese was an ethnic German immigrant, who had been orphaned during the war. Although she was not Jewish, she was well-liked by Soros's parents as she had also experienced the privation and displacement brought about by [[World War II]].Kaufman, Michael T., [https://books.google.com/books?id=UUncnapj_hIC&pg=PT134&lpg=PT134&dq=annaliese+witschak+soros#v=onepage&q=annaliese ''Soros: The Life and Times of a Messianic Billionaire''.] They divorced in 1983. They had three children: *Robert Daniel Soros (born 1963): The founder of the [[Central European University]] in Budapest, as well as a network of foundations in Eastern Europe. In 1992, he married Melissa Robin Schiff at the [[Congregation Emanu-El of New York|Temple Emanu-El]] in New York City. The Rabbi Dr. David Posner officiated the ceremony.[https://www.nytimes.com/1992/05/24/style/weddings-melissa-schiff-robert-d-soros.html New York Times: "WEDDINGS; Melissa Schiff, Robert D. Soros"] May 24, 1992. *Andrea Soros Colombel (born June 11, 1965): The founder and president of Trace Foundation, established in 1993 to promote the cultural continuity and sustainable development of [[Tibetan people|Tibetan]] communities within China. She is also a founding partner and member of the board of directors of the [[Acumen Fund]], a global venture fund that employs an entrepreneurial approach in addressing the problems of global poverty[http://www.acumenfund.org/about-us/board-of-directors.html Acumen Fund Board of Directors biographies: Andrea Soros Colombel] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120527161032/http://www.acumenfund.org/about-us/board-of-directors.html|date=May 27, 2012}} retrieved May 26, 2012. She is married to Eric Colombel (born October 26, 1963). *[[Jonathan Soros|Jonathan Tivadar Soros]] (born September 10, 1970): A hedge fund manager and political donor. In 2012, he co-founded [[Every Voice|Friends of Democracy]], a super PAC dedicated to reducing the influence of money in politics. In 1997, he married Jennifer Ann Allan (born November 26, 1969).[https://www.nytimes.com/1997/08/17/style/jonathan-soros-and-jennifer-allan.html ''New York Times'': "Jonathan Soros and Jennifer Allan"], August 17, 1997. In 1983, George Soros married [[Susan Weber Soros|Susan Weber]] (born April 15, 1955), 25 years his junior. They divorced in 2005. They have two children: *[[Alexander Soros]] (born 1985): Alexander has gained prominence for his donations to social and political causes, focusing his philanthropic efforts on "progressive causes that might not have widespread support."{{Cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424053111904060604576573191027617806 |title=Younger Soros Tries to Learn From Father's Giving|last=West|first=Melanie Grayce|date=September 16, 2011|work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|access-date=September 16, 2011}} Alexander serves on the boards of [[Jewish Funds for Justice]] and [[Global Witness]], and led the list of student political donors in the 2010 election cycle.Hepler, Lauren (October 20, 2010). [http://www.opensecrets.org/news/2010/10/college-life-conjures-visions-of.html "Led By George Soros' Son, Student Contributions Buoy Democrats in 2010 Midterms"]. ''OpenSecretsBlog''. [[Center for Responsive Politics]]. *Gregory James Soros (born 1988), artist In 2008, Soros met his current wife, Tamiko M. Bolton, who was born October 18, 1971 and is 42 years his junior;{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/personalfinance/investing/9471568/George-Sortos-82-engaged-to-yoga-website-boss-Tamiko-Bolton-40.html|title=George Soros, 82, engaged to yoga website boss Tamiko Bolton, 40|date=August 13, 2012|work=Telegraph.co.uk|access-date=July 20, 2015}} he married her on September 21, 2013.{{cite web|url=http://pagesix.com/2013/09/22/george-soros-ties-the-knot/|title=George Soros ties the knot|publisher=NY Post|access-date=September 22, 2013|date=September 22, 2013}} Bolton is the daughter of a [[Japanese-American]] nurse and a retired naval commander, Robert J. Bolton (born October 18, 1946). She was raised in California, earned an MBA from the [[University of Miami]], and runs an Internet-based dietary supplement and vitamin-sales company.[http://pagesix.com/2012/08/12/soros-to-marry-again-at-82/ New York Post: "Soros to marry again at 82"] August 12, 2012 Soros's older brother [[Paul Soros]], a private investor and philanthropist, died on June 15, 2013.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/06/16/business/paul-soros-shipping-innovator-dies-at-87.html|title=Paul Soros, Shipping Innovator, Dies at 87|last=Hershey, Jr.|first=Robert D.|date=June 15, 2013|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|access-date=June 15, 2013}} Also an engineer, Paul headed Soros Associates and established the Paul and Daisy Soros Fellowships for Young Americans.{{cite web|url=http://www.pdsoros.org/overview/ |title=Fellowship Background & History |publisher=Paul and Dora Soros Fellowships for Young Americans |access-date=March 22, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090327060847/http://www.pdsoros.org/overview/ |archivedate=March 27, 2009 }}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1998/06/17/nyregion/public-lives-an-overshadowed-altruist-sees-the-light.html|title=Public Lives: An Overshadowed Altruist Sees the Light|last=Bumiller|first=Elisabeth|date=June 17, 1998|work=The New York Times|access-date=March 22, 2009}} He was married to [[Daisy Soros]] (née Schlenger), who, like her husband, was a [[Hungarian Jewish]] immigrant,[http://burgenland.orf.at/tv/stories/2509288/ Burgenland: "Daisy Soros: Rückkehr nach 76 Jahren"], retrieved May 26, 2012. and with whom he had two sons, Peter and Jeffrey.[http://archive.poly.edu/alumni/_docs/Giants-soros.pdf "Visionary Engineer Master Pom Builder Philanthropist: Paul Soros"] retrieved May 26, 2012. Peter Soros was married to the former [[Flora Fraser (writer)|Flora Fraser]], a daughter of [[Antonia Fraser|Lady Antonia Fraser]] and the late [[Hugh Fraser (British politician)|Sir Hugh Fraser]] and a stepdaughter of the late 2005 [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Nobel Laureate]] [[Harold Pinter]]. Fraser and Soros separated in 2009.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1997/02/02/style/peter-soros-and-flora-fraser.html|title=Peter Soros and Flora Fraser|date=February 2, 1997|work=The New York Times|access-date=March 22, 2009}} In 2005, Soros was a minority partner in a group that tried to buy the [[Washington Nationals]], a [[Major League Baseball|Major League]] baseball team. Some Republican lawmakers suggested that they might move to revoke [[Major League Baseball]]'s antitrust exemption if Soros bought the team.{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2005/06/27/AR2005062701447.html|title=Soros's Nats Bid Irks Republicans|date=June 28, 2005|work=The Washington Post|access-date=May 19, 2010}} In 2008, Soros's name was associated with [[AS Roma]], an Italian association football team, but the club was not sold. Soros was a financial backer of Washington Soccer L.P., the group that owned the operating rights to [[Major League Soccer]] club [[D.C. United]] when the league was founded in 1995, but the group lost these rights in 2000.{{Cite news|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/washingtonpost/access/62439758.html?dids=62439758:62439758&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&fmac=&date=Oct+12%2C+2000&author=Steven+Goff&desc=United%27s+Ownership+Uncertain%3B+After+Sale+Fell+Through%2C+MLS+Might+Take+Over+Operation|title=United's Ownership Uncertain; After Sale Fell Through, MLS Might Take Over Operation|last=Goff|first=Steven|date=October 12, 2000|publisher=Pqasb.pqarchiver.com|access-date=October 16, 2009}} On August 21, 2012, [[BBC]] reported SEC filings showing Soros acquired roughly a 1.9 percent stake in English football club [[Manchester United]] through the purchase of 3.1 million of the club's Class-A shares.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-19328750|title=Manchester United: George Soros invests in football club|date=August 21, 2012|work=BBC|access-date=August 21, 2012}} == Political involvement == Soros was not a large donor to U.S. political causes until the 2004 presidential election, but according to the [[Center for Responsive Politics]], during the 2003–2004 election cycle, Soros donated $23,581,000 to various [[527 Group]]s (tax-exempt groups under the United States tax code, 26 U.S.C. § 527). The groups aimed to defeat President [[George W. Bush]]. After Bush's reelection, Soros and other donors backed a new political fundraising group called [[Democracy Alliance]], which supports progressive causes and the formation of a stronger progressive infrastructure in America.{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/07/16/AR2006071600882_pf.html|title=New Alliance of Democrats Spreads Funding|work=The Washington Post|access-date=July 17, 2006}} In August 2009, Soros donated $35 million to the state of New York to be earmarked for underprivileged children and given to parents who had benefit cards at the rate of $200 per child aged 3 through 17, with no limit as to the number of children that qualified. An additional $140 million was put into the fund by the state of New York from money they had received from the [[American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009|2009 federal recovery act]]. Soros was an initial donor to the [[Center for American Progress]], and he continues to support the organization through the [[Open Society Foundations]]. In October 2011, a [[Reuters]] story, "Soros: Not a funder of [[Occupy Wall Street|Wall Street Protests]]," was published after several commentators pointed out errors in an earlier Reuters story headlined "Who's Behind the Wall St. Protests?" with a lede stating that the [[Occupy Wall Street]] movement "may have benefited indirectly from the largesse of one of the world's richest men [Soros]." Reuters's follow-up article also reported a Soros spokesman and [[Adbusters]]' co-founder [[Kalle Lasn]] both saying that Adbusters—the reputed catalyst for the first Occupy Wall Street protests—had never received any contributions from Soros, contrary to Reuters's earlier story that reported that "indirect financial links" existed between the two as late as 2010.Egan, Mark; Nichols, Michelle (October 13, 2011). [https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/10/14/us-wallstreet-protests-funding-idUSTRE79D01Q20111014 "Soros: not a funder of Wall Street protests"]. Reuters; retrieved October 14, 2011.Egan, Mark; Nichols, Michelle (October 13, 2011). [https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/10/14/us-wallstreet-protests-origins-idUSTRE79C1YN20111014 "Who's behind the Wall St. protests?"]. Reuters; retrieved October 13, 2011. On September 27, 2012, Soros announced that he was donating $1 million to the super PAC backing [[Barack Obama|President Barack Obama]]'s reelection [[Priorities USA Action]].{{cite news|url=http://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/09/27/soros-gives-1-million-to-democratic-super-pac/?smid=tw-nytimes|title=Soros Gives $1 Million to Democratic 'Super PAC{{'-}}|last=Confessore|first=Nicholas|date=September 27, 2012|work=The New York Times}} In October 2013, Soros donated $25,000 to [[Ready for Hillary]], becoming a co-chairman of the super PAC's national finance committee.{{Cite news|url=http://www.politico.com/story/2013/10/george-soros-hillary-clinton-98796.html|title=George Soros going to bat for Hillary Clinton|last=Haberman|first=Maggie|date=October 24, 2013|work=Politico|access-date=November 2, 2013}} In June 2015, he donated $1 million to the Super PAC [[Priorities USA Action]], which supported [[Hillary Clinton]] in the [[United States presidential election, 2016|2016 presidential race]]. He donated $6 million to the PAC in December 2015 and $2.5 million in August 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.opensecrets.org/pacs/pacgave2.php?cmte=C00495861&cycle=2016|title=Priorities USA Action Contributors, 2016 cycle – OpenSecrets|publisher=}} === Central and Eastern Europe === [[File:Anti-Soros demonstrations (Tbilisi Sep 28, 2005).jpg|thumb|200px|Protesters in [[Tbilisi]] with flag of the [[Democratic Republic of Georgia]] blocking the way from the Open Society Institute office, 2005]] According to Waldemar A. Nielsen, an authority on American philanthropy,{{cite news| first= Wolfgang| last= Saxon| url= https://www.nytimes.com/2005/11/04/nyregion/04nielsen.html |title= Waldemar Nielsen, Expert on Philanthropy, Dies at 88| work= The New York Times| date= November 4, 2005}} "[Soros] has undertaken ... nothing less than to open up the once-closed communist societies of Eastern Europe to a free flow of ideas and scientific knowledge from the outside world."{{cite book| first= Waldemar A.| last= Nielsen | title= Inside American Philanthropy: The Dramas of Donorship| publisher= University of Oklahoma Press| year= 1996| page= 77}} From 1979, as an advocate of '[[Open society|open societies]]', Soros financially supported dissidents including Poland's [[Solidarity (Polish trade union)|Solidarity]] movement, [[Charter 77]] in Czechoslovakia and [[Andrei Sakharov]] in the [[Soviet Union]].[https://www.opensocietyfoundations.org/people/george-soros George Soros, Founder/Chairman], Open Society Foundation In 1984, he founded his first Open Society Institute in Hungary with a budget of $3 million.{{cite web | first= George| last= Soros |url= http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/07/27/aoc.soros.opensociety/index.html |title= Soros: In revolutionary times the impossible becomes possible| website= CNN.com| date= November 4, 2009}} Since the fall of the Soviet Union, Soros' funding has continued to play an important role in the former Soviet sphere. His funding of pro-democratic programs in [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] was considered by Georgian nationalists to be crucial to the success of the [[Rose Revolution]], although Soros has said that his role has been "greatly exaggerated."{{cite web|url=http://archive.newsmax.com/archives/articles/2005/5/31/164945.shtml |title=Soros Downplays Role in Georgia Revolution |date=June 1, 2005 |publisher=Archive.newsmax.com |access-date=October 16, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090207024037/http://archive.newsmax.com/archives/articles/2005/5/31/164945.shtml |archivedate=February 7, 2009 |df= }} [[Alexander Lomaia]], Secretary of the Georgian Security Council and former Minister of Education and Science, is a former Executive Director of the Open Society Georgia Foundation ([[Soros Foundation]]), overseeing a staff of 50 and a budget of $2.5 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.oecd.org/document/49/0,2340,en_21571361_36507471_37001521_1_1_1_1,00.html |title=Alexander Lomaia – Minister of Education and Science (Georgia) |publisher=Oecd.org |access-date=October 16, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090211061157/http://www.oecd.org/document/49/0%2C2340%2Cen_21571361_36507471_37001521_1_1_1_1%2C00.html |archivedate=February 11, 2009 |df= }} Former Georgian foreign minister [[Salomé Zourabichvili]] wrote that institutions like the Soros Foundation were the cradle of democratization and that all the NGOs that gravitated around the Soros Foundation undeniably carried the revolution. She opines that after the revolution the Soros Foundation and the NGOs were integrated into power.{{cite news| first= Salomé| last= Zourabichvili| work= Herodote| title= Article| publisher= French Institute for Geopolitics| date= April 2008}} Some Soros-backed pro-democracy initiatives have been banned in [[Kazakhstan]] and [[Turkmenistan]].{{cite news| first= Fred| last= Weir| url= http://www.csmonitor.com/2005/0210/p01s03-wosc.html |title= Democracy rising in ex-Soviet states| work= [[The Christian Science Monitor]]| date= February 10, 2005}} Ercis Kurtulus, head of the Social Transparency Movement Association (TSHD) in [[Turkey]], said in an interview that "Soros carried out his will in Ukraine and Georgia by using these NGOs ... Last year Russia passed a special law prohibiting NGOs from taking money from foreigners. I think this should be banned in Turkey as well."{{cite web|url=http://www.globalpolicy.org/ngos/fund/2006/1011puppets.htm|title=Does Foreign Funding Make NGOs into Puppets?|date=October 11, 2006|website= Globalpolicy.org |access-date=October 16, 2009}} In 1997, Soros closed his foundation in [[Belarus]] after it was fined $3 million by the government for "tax and currency violations." According to ''The New York Times'', the Belarusian president [[Alexander Lukashenko]] has been widely criticized in the West and in Russia for his efforts to control the Belarus Soros Foundation and other independent NGOs and to suppress civil and human rights. Soros called the fines part of a campaign to "destroy independent society."{{Cite news| url= https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9400E0D91530F937A3575AC0A961958260|title=Soros Closes Foundation in Belarus|last=Miller|first=Judith|date=September 4, 1997|work=The New York Times|access-date=October 16, 2009}} In June 2009, Soros donated $100 million to Central Europe and Eastern Europe to counter the impact of the [[Late-2000s recession|economic crisis]] on the poor, voluntary groups and non-government organisations.[http://www.unian.net/eng/news/news-321844.html Soros donates $100 million to Europe], [[Ukrainian Independent Information Agency]] (UNIAN), June 19, 2009. Since 2012 the Hungarian [[Third Orbán Government|Fidesz government]] gradually and strategically selected George Soros as [[enemy of the state]] for various reasons, with the focus on the deliberate misinterpretation of his humanitarian and political involvement in the [[European refugee crisis]]. The government has attacked [[Open Society Foundations|OSF]], the international civil support foundation created by George Soros, including various legal changes to revoke the permission of [[Central European University#Amendment to Act CCIV of 2011 on National Higher Education in the Hungarian Parliament (2017)|Central European University]] (Budapest) (which failed mostly due to significant public outrage{{cite web | url=https://www.ceu.edu/category/istandwithceu | title=#IStartWithCeu | publisher=CEU | accessdate=April 18, 2018 }}). In response Soros called the government "a mafia state".{{ cite news | url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/jun/01/george-soros-attacks-hungarian-president-building-mafia-state | title=George Soros attacks Hungarian prime minister for building a 'mafia state' | date=June 1, 2017 | accessdate=April 18, 2018 | work=The Guardian | author=Jennifer Rankin }} As the 2018 election period started the government introduced public posters with the photo of Soros,{{cite web | url=http://img3.hvg.hu/image.aspx?id=4099562d-ee70-4221-bb53-c4952af5c15a&view=da658e97-86c0-40f3-acd3-b0a850f32c30 | title=Soros large poster | author=Hungarian government | publisher=HVG }} to create hostility in the general public towards him, using statements such as "Soros wants millions of migrants to live in Hungary", and "Soros wants to dismantle the [[Hungarian border barrier|border fence]]". The government also prepared a three-part law plan called "Stop Soros package" (which followed other various law changes2017. évi LXXVI. törvény (LXXVI. law of 2017) in the same year which hindered workings of several international NGOs in Hungary), which would include various steps against NGOs doing volunteer work related to the refugee crisis. Soros left most of these attacks without comments apart from a few short statements about the invalidity of the accusations.{{citation needed|date=June 2018}} [[File:Anti George Soros sentiment graffiti in Resen Macedonia 2018.jpg|thumb|right|220x220px|Anti George Soros sentiment graffiti in [[Resen, Macedonia|Resen]], Macedonia (2018). It reads: #Stop Soros #I will profit]] In March 2017, six US senators sent a letter to their Secretary of State [[Rex Tillerson]]{{Cite news|url=https://spectator.org/macedonia-to-george-soros-and-usaid-go-away/|title=Macedonia to George Soros and USAID: Go Away|date=March 24, 2017|work=The American Spectator|access-date=July 25, 2017|language=en-US}} asking that he look into several grants the State Department and the US Agency for International Development (USAID) have given to groups funded by "left-wing" Soros. According to the [[Heritage Foundation]], the letter expressed specific concern about Soros' influence on Macedonian politics, a concern which has also been expressed by members of the conservative Macedonian government.{{cite web|url=http://dailysignal.com/2017/03/28/george-soros-co-opted-millions-in-us-taxpayer-dollars-why-rex-tillerson-is-the-man-to-fix-it/|title=Rex Tillerson Should Investigate Soros Activity in Macedonia|date=March 28, 2017|website=The Daily Signal|access-date=July 25, 2017}} In the same context, Judicial Watch has filed a [[Freedom of Information Act (United States)|Freedom of Information Act]] (FOIA) lawsuit against the U.S. Department of State and USAID compelling them to release records regarding $5 million transferred from USAID to Soros' Open Society branch in Macedonia. The suit alleges that the money was deliberately used to destabilize the Macedonian government.{{Cite news|url=http://thehill.com/blogs/pundits-blog/international/331026-why-is-the-state-department-refusing-to-disclose-soros|title=Why is the State Department refusing to disclose Soros' involvement in Macedonia?|last=Takala|first=Rudy|date=April 28, 2017|work=TheHill|access-date=July 25, 2017}} In January 2017, the "Stop Operation Soros" (SOS) initiative was launched in Macedonia. SOS seeks to present "questions and answers about the way Soros operates worldwide" and invites citizens to contribute to the research. In a press conference held during the same month, Nenad Mircevski, one of the founders of the initiative, stated that SOS would work towards the "de-Soros-ization" of Macedonia.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/01/world/europe/after-trump-win-anti-soros-forces-are-emboldened-in-eastern-europe.html|title=After Trump Win, Anti-Soros Forces Are Emboldened in Eastern Europe|last=Lyman|first=Rick|date=March 1, 2017|work=The New York Times|access-date=July 25, 2017|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.rt.com/news/374241-stop-operation-soros-movement-macedonia/|title='Stop Operation Soros' movement begins in Macedonia|work=RT International|access-date=July 25, 2017|language=en-US}} On May 16, 2018, Soros' [[Open Society Foundations]] announced they will move its office from Budapest to Berlin, blaming the move on an "increasingly repressive" environment in Hungary.{{cite news|url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2018/05/george-soros-foundation-close-office-repressive-hungary-180515160314017.html|title=George Soros foundation to close office in 'repressive' Hungary|work=aljazeera.com}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-44082976|title=Soros foundation to leave Hungary|date=May 15, 2018|publisher=|via=www.bbc.com}}{{cite 'repressive' policies|date=May 15, 2018|work=The Daily Telegraph|location=London}} === Africa === The [[Open Society Initiative for Southern Africa]] is a Soros-affiliated organization.{{cite web|url=https://www.opensocietyfoundations.org/about/offices-foundations/open-society-initiative-southern-africa|title=Open Society Initiative for Southern Africa|work=opensocietyfoundations.org|access-date=October 11, 2016}} Its director for [[Zimbabwe]] is Godfrey Kanyenze, who also directs the [[Zimbabwe Congress of Trade Unions]] (ZCTU), which was the main force behind the founding of the [[Movement for Democratic Change (pre-2005)|Movement for Democratic Change]], the principal indigenous organization promoting [[regime change]] in Zimbabwe. ''The New York Times.'' March 3, 2007. ''[[GlobalPost]]''. April 12, 2010. [[Somaliland]] and the [[Polisario Front]] of [[Western Sahara]]. ===Drug policy reform=== Soros has funded worldwide efforts to promote [[drug policy reform]]. In 2008, Soros donated $400,000 to help fund a successful ballot measure in Massachusetts known as the [[Massachusetts Sensible Marijuana Policy Initiative]] which decriminalized possession of less than 1 oz (28g) of marijuana in the state. Soros has also funded similar measures in California, Alaska, Oregon, Washington, Colorado, Nevada and Maine.LeBlanc, Steve, [http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5hQsksgZ-IN6nYS3jJ2NcqpufBlLgD92QQPS00 Soros behind Mass. effort to decriminalize pot], Associated Press, August 27, 2008 {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080831060134/http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5hQsksgZ-IN6nYS3jJ2NcqpufBlLgD92QQPS00|date=August 31, 2008}} Among the drug decriminalization groups that have received funding from Soros are the [[Lindesmith Center]] and [[Drug Policy Foundation]].[http://norml.org/index.cfm?Group_ID=4416 Norml.org], National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws Soros donated $1.4 million to publicity efforts to support California's [[California Proposition 5 (2008)|Proposition 5]] in 2008, a failed ballot measure that would have expanded [[drug rehabilitation]] programs as alternatives to prison for persons convicted of non-violent drug-related offenses.{{Cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/news/la-me-billionaires1-2008nov01,0,3904554.story|title=Wealthy Californians put their agendas to a vote|last=Halper|first=Evan|date=November 1, 2008|work=Los Angeles Times|access-date=October 16, 2009}} In October 2010, Soros donated $1 million to support California's [[California Proposition 19 (2010)|Proposition 19]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/nov05election/detail?entry_id=75546|title=George Soros gives $1 million to Prop. 19 campaign|last=Fagan|first=Kevin|date=October 26, 2010|work=San Francisco Chronicle|access-date=October 30, 2010}} According to remarks in an interview in October 2009, it is Soros' opinion that marijuana is less addictive but not appropriate for use by children and students. He himself has not used marijuana for years.[http://www.sr.se/webbradio/webbradio.asp?type=db&Id=1992351&BroadcastDate=&IsBlock= Gorge Soros. Ekots lördagsintevju]{{dead link|date=January 2017|bot=InternetArchiveBot|fix-attempted=yes}}, Swedish Radio, October 10, 2009. marijuana|work=The Washingtion Times|access-date=July 20, 2015}} === Death and dying === The Project on Death in America, active from 1994 to 2003,{{cite physician-assisted suicide |publisher=Findarticles.com |year=1997 |access-date=October 16, 2009 |deadurl=yes Despite Republican Claims, No|publisher=|accessdate=October 24, 2018|newspaper=The New York Times|date=October 20, 2018|last1=Qiu|first1=Linda}}{{cite web|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/latino/five-myths-about-honduran-caravan-debunked-n922806|title=Five myths about the Honduran caravan debunked|publisher=|accessdate=October 24, 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/10/23/business/kelly-johnston-soros-campbell/index.html|title=Campbell Soup disavows Soros conspiracy theory tweeted by VP|author=Danielle Wiener-Bronner|work=CNN|accessdate=October 24, 2018}} The theory that Soros was somehow causing Central American migration at the southern US border apparently dates back to late March 2018, however.{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/a-conspiracy-theory-about-george-soros-and-a-migrant-caravan-inspired-horror/2018/10/28/52df587e-dae6-11e8-b732-3c72cbf131f2_story.html|title=A conspiracy theory about George Soros and a migrant caravan inspired horror|work=Washington Post|author=Joel Achenbach|date=October 28, 2018}} The October 2018 strain of the theory has been described to combine [[anti-semitism]], anti-immigrant sentiment and " the specter of powerful foreign agents controlling major world events in pursuit of a hidden agenda", connecting Soros and other wealthy individuals of Jewish faith or background to the October caravan. Both [[Cesar Sayoc]], the perpetrator of the October 2018 attempted bombings of prominent Democrats, and Robert Bowers, the perpetrator of the [[Pittsburgh synagogue shooting]], referred to this conspiracy theory on social media before their crimes.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/oct/27/pittsburgh-synagogue-shooting-antisemitism-conspiracy-theories|title=Pittsburgh shooting extends wave of conspiracy-minded rightwing violence|author=Jason Wilson|work=The Guardian|location=London|date=October 27, 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/robert-bowers-is-neo-nazi-who-posted-about-killing-jews-on-gab?via=desktop&social=Linkedin|title=Pittsburgh Synagogue Suspect Robert Bowers Hated Trump—for Not Hating Jews|agency=Daily Beast|author=Kelly Weill|date=October 27, 2018}} ===Attempted bomb attack=== A [[pipe bomb]] was placed in the mailbox at Soros's [[Katonah, New York]] home on October 22, 2018, as part of the [[October 2018 United States mail bombing attempts]]. The package was discovered by a caretaker,{{cite web|url=https://www.newyorker.com/news/current/the-bombs-addressed-to-obama-clinton-and-soros-and-the-history-of-soros-mongering|title=The Bombs Addressed to Obama, Clinton, and Soros, and the History of Anti-Soros Hate-Mongering|publisher=[[The New Yorker]]|first=Eric|last=Lach|date=October 24, 2018}} who removed it and notified authorities. It was photographed and exploded by the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]], which launched an investigation.{{cite web |last1=Hutchinson |first1=Bill |last2=Katersky |first2=Aaron |last3=Margolin |first3=Josh |last4=Crudele |first4=Mark |title=Would-be attacker hand-delivered pipe bomb to George Soros' home mailbox: Source |url=https://abcnews.go.com/US/billionaire-philanthropist-george-soros-home-explosive-device-found/story?id=58683450 |website=ABC News |accessdate=October 24, 2018 |date=October 23, 2018}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/10/22/nyregion/george-soros-explosive-device.html|title=At George Soros's Home in N.Y. Suburb, Explosive Device Is Found in Mailbox|publisher=|accessdate=October 23, 2018|newspaper=''The New York Times''|date=October 22, 2018|last1=Rashbaum|first1=William K.|last2=Mervosh|first2=Sarah|last3=Chow|first3=Andrew R.}} Two days later, similar bombs were mailed to [[Hillary Clinton]], [[Barack Obama]], other Democrats, and [[John O. Brennan|John Brennan]] (mailed to CNN New York studios).{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/10/24/nyregion/clinton-obama-explosive-device.html|title=Explosive Devices Found in Mail Sent to Hillary Clinton and Obama|publisher=''The New York Times''|date=October 24, 2018|access-date=October 24, 2018|language=en}} On October 26, 2018, Cesar Sayoc, a registered Republican and Trump supporter, was arrested in Aventura, Florida on suspicion of mailing the bombs.{{cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/10/26/politics/suspicious-packages-arrest/index.html|title=Bomb suspect arrest: What we know about Cesar Sayoc|first=Jason Hanna, Evan Perez, Scott Glover, Steve Almasy and Ray Sanchez,|last=CNN|publisher=}} ==Political and economic views== {{external media | width = 210px | float = right | headerimage=[[File:George Soros - Festival Economia 2012 02.JPG|210px]] '''George Soros''' | video1 = [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f-XT1hnkXZY The Lecture Series: Introduction], 2:56 | video2 = [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oCaCrWzFPYY General Theory of Reflexivity], 52:00 | video3 = [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RHSEEJDKJho Financial Markets], 43:59 | video4 = [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DFyfYBcbbac Open Society], 43:39 | video5 = [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bDrTkvFB6Zk Capitalism vs. Open Society], 47:38 all by the [[Open Society Foundations]] | access-date =October 16, 2015 }} ===Reflexivity, financial markets, and economic theory=== Soros's writings focus heavily on the concept of [[reflexivity (social theory)|reflexivity]], where the biases of individuals enter into market transactions, potentially changing the fundamentals of the economy. Soros argues that different principles apply in markets depending on whether they are in a "near to equilibrium" or a "far from equilibrium" state. He argues that, when markets are rising or falling rapidly, they are typically marked by disequilibrium rather than equilibrium, and that the conventional economic theory of the market (the '[[efficient market hypothesis]]') does not apply in these situations. Soros has popularized the concepts of dynamic disequilibrium, static disequilibrium, and near-equilibrium conditions. He has stated that his own financial success has been attributable to the edge accorded by his understanding of the action of the reflexive effect. Reflexivity is based on three main ideas: # Reflexivity is best observed under special conditions where investor bias grows and spreads throughout the investment arena. Examples of factors that may give rise to this bias include (a) equity leveraging or (b) the [[Trend following|trend-following]] habits of speculators. # Reflexivity appears intermittently since it is most likely to be revealed under certain conditions; i.e., the character of the equilibrium process is best considered in terms of probabilities. # Investors' observation of and participation in the capital markets may at times influence valuations and fundamental conditions or outcomes. A recent example of reflexivity in modern financial markets is that of the debt and equity of housing markets. Lenders began to make more money available to more people in the 1990s to buy houses. More people bought houses with this larger amount of money, thus increasing the prices of these houses. Lenders looked at their balance sheets which not only showed that they had made more loans, but that the collaterals backing the loans – the value of the houses – had gone up (because more money was chasing the same amount of housing, relatively). Thus they lent out more money because their balance sheets looked good, and prices rose higher still. This was further amplified by public policy. In the US, home loans were guaranteed by the Federal government. Many national governments saw home ownership as a positive outcome and so introduced grants for first-time home buyers and other financial subsidies, such as the exemption of a primary residence from capital gains taxation. These further encouraged house purchases, leading to further price rises and further relaxation of lending standards. The concept of reflexivity attempts to explain why markets moving from one equilibrium state to another tend to overshoot or undershoot. Soros's theories were originally dismissed by economists,{{cite journal|last=Solow|first=Robert|title=The Amateur|journal=The New Republic|date=February 8, 1999|url= }} but have received more attention after the 2008 crash including becoming the focus of an issue of the ''[[Journal of Economic Methodology]]''.{{cite journal| editor-last= Hands| editor-first= D. Wade |title=Reflexivity and Economics: George Soros's Theory of Reflexivity and the Methodology of Economic Science|journal=Journal of Economic Methodology|volume=20|series=2013|issue=4|url=http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/1350178X.2013.859415#tabModule|doi=10.1080/1350178X.2013.859415|pages=309–329| year= 2013 }} The notion of reflexivity provides an explanation of the theories of [[Complexity economics]], as developed at the [[Santa Fe Institute]], although Soros had not publicised his views at the time the discipline was originally developed there in the 1980s.{{cite book |first=W. Brian |last=Arthur |chapter=Complexity economics: a different framework for economic thought |title=Complexity and the Economy |location=Oxford |publisher=Oxford University Press |year=2014 |isbn=978-0-19-933429-2 |chapterurl=http://complexity.stanford.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/Econ-Frame.A4.pdf }}{{Cite journal| url= http://epublications.marquette.edu/econ_fac/385/|title= Soros's Reflexivity Concept in a Complex World: Cauchy Distributions| first= John| last= Davis|journal=Marquette.edu|date= December 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://www.oxfordmartin.ox.ac.uk/videos/view/172| title= Why do we need an Institute for New Economic Thinking at Oxford? – Videos|work=Oxford Martin School}}{{cite journal|url=http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/1350178X.2013.859403#preview|title= Reflexivity, complexity, and the nature of social science| doi=10.1080/1350178X.2013.859403 | volume=20|issue= 4|journal=Journal of Economic Methodology|pages=330–342|year= 2013|last1= Beinhocker|first1= Eric D.}} ===Reflexivity in politics=== Although the primary manifestation of the reflexive process that Soros discusses is its effects in the financial markets, he has also explored its effects in politics. He has stated that whereas the greatest threats to the "[[Open Society]]" in the past were from Communism and Fascism (as discussed in ''[[The Open Society and its Enemies]]'' by his mentor [[Karl Popper]]), the largest current threat is from [[market fundamentalism]]. He has suggested that the contemporary domination of world politics and world trade by the United States is a reflexive phenomenon, insofar as the success of military and financial coercion feeds back to encourage increasingly intense applications of the same policies to the point where they will eventually become unsustainable.{{cite book| title= The Bubble of American Supremacy: Correcting the Misuse of American Power| publisher= PublicAffairs| year= 2003 | isbn= 978-1-58648-217-6}} ===View of problems in the free market system=== Soros argues that the current system of financial speculation undermines healthy economic development in many underdeveloped countries. He blames many of the world's problems on the failures inherent in what he characterizes as [[market fundamentalism]].{{Cite book|url= |title=The Alchemy of Finance|last=Soros|first=George|publisher=John Wiley & Sons |year= 2003| isbn= 978-0-471-44549-4 |page= 13}} Soros claims to draw a distinction between being a participant in the market and working to change the rules that market participants must follow. ==== Market predictions ==== Soros's book ''The New Paradigm for Financial Markets'' (May 2008), described a "superbubble" that had built up over the past 25 years and was ready to collapse. This was the third in a series of books he has written that have predicted disaster. As he states: {{quote|I have a record of crying wolf ... I did it first in ''The [[Alchemy]] of Finance'' (in 1987), then in ''The Crisis of Global Capitalism'' (in 1998), and now in this book. So it's three books predicting disaster. [After] the boy cried wolf three times ... the wolf really came."[https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB121400427331093457 Soros, the Man Who Cries Wolf], Now Is Warning of a 'Superbubble'" by Greg Ip, B1, June 21–22, 2008 ''The Wall Street Journal''.}} He ascribes his own success to being able to recognize when his predictions are wrong. {{quote|I'm only rich because I know when I'm wrong ... I basically have survived by recognizing my mistakes. I very often used to get backaches due to the fact that I was wrong. Whenever you are wrong you have to fight or [take] flight. When [I] make the decision, the backache goes away.}} In February 2009, Soros said the world financial system had in effect disintegrated, adding that there was no prospect of a near-term resolution to the crisis.[https://www.reuters.com/article/newsOne/idUSTRE51K0A920090221 Soros sees no bottom for world financial "collapse"], ''[[Reuters]]'', February 21, 2009, Retrieved August 17, 2009. "We witnessed the collapse of the financial system ... It was placed on life support, and it's still on life support. There's no sign that we are anywhere near a bottom." In January 2016, at an economic forum in Sri Lanka, Soros predicted a [[Financial crisis of 2007–08|financial crisis akin to 2008]] based on the state of the global currency, stock and commodity markets as well as the sinking [[Chinese yuan]]. {{quote|China has a major adjustment problem. I would say it amounts to a crisis. When I look at the financial markets there is a serious challenge which reminds me of the crisis we had in 2008.{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-01-07/global-markets-at-the-beginning-of-a-crisis-george-soros-says |title=George Soros Sees Crisis in Global Markets That Echoes 2008 |last1=Haigh |first1=Adam |last2=Ondaatjie |first2=Anusha |date=6 January 2016 |website=bloomberg.com |publisher=Bloomberg LP |access-date=15 January 2016}}{{cite web During an award ceremony for [[Imre Kertész]], Soros said that the victims of violence and abuse were becoming "perpetrators of violence," suggesting that this model explained Israel's behavior towards the Palestinians, which led to walkouts and Soros being booed.[http://forward.com/the-assimilator/338433/the-night-george-soros-stood-in-for-nobelist-holocaust-survivor-imre-kertes The Night George Soros Stood In For Nobelist Holocaust Survivor Imre Kertesz] April 12, 2016, The Forward, By Masha Leon In July 2017, the Israeli ambassador in Hungary joined Jewish groups and others in denouncing a billboard campaign backed by Hungarian Prime Minister [[Viktor Orbán]], in which Soros was vilified as an "enemy of the state". The campaign was widely seen as anti-semitic, with critics claiming it "evokes memories of the Nazi posters during the Second World War". Hungary's [[right-wing]] government had frequently attacked Soros, particularly for his support for more open immigration. Hours later, in an apparent attempt to ally Israel with Hungary, Israel's [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Israel)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] issued a "clarification", denouncing Soros, stating that he "continuously undermines Israel's democratically elected governments," and that Soros funded organizations "that defame the Jewish state and seek to deny it the right to defend itself". The Israeli government has sought to ally itself with countries within the EU that might defend it from criticism; the clarification came a few days before an official visit to Hungary by Israeli Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]].[https://www.reuters.com/article/us-israel-hungary-soros-idUSKBN19V1J4 Israel backs Hungary, says financier Soros is a threat] By Luke Baker, July 10, 2017, Reuters ===Views on the U.S.=== On November 11, 2003, in an interview with ''[[The Washington Post]]'', Soros said that removing President George W. He said he would sacrifice his entire fortune to defeat Bush "if someone guaranteed it."Laura Blumenfeld, [http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2003-11-23/news/0311220187_1_george-soros-oust-bush-democratic-party Deep Pockets vs. Bush, Financier Contributes $5 Million More in Effort to Oust President], ''The Washington Post'', November 11, 2003; p.
